posts.title: How to Setup Microsoft SQL Server
posts.author: Cameron
posts.description: A walkthrough for installing and setting up Microsoft SQL Server.
posts.content:
# Installing and Configuring Microsoft SQL Server: A Comprehensive Guide

This will be a walkthrough of the process of installing and setting up Microsoft SQL Server. This guide is designed to assist individuals looking into database management. Let's dive into the steps:

## Step 1: Download Microsoft SQL Server

- Visit the official Microsoft SQL Server download page.
- Choose the appropriate edition for your needs (Year, operating system), and click on the download link for the developer version since it has free licensing for development and testing.

## Step 2: Installation Process

- Run the downloaded executable file to initiate the installation process.
- For installation type, I would recommend you opt for the basic installation for a standard setup, but you can choose custom for more control over your features.

## Step 3: Feature Selection

- Select the features you want to install. I would recommend Database Engine Services, SQL Server Replication, and Full-Text and Semantic Extractions. However, feel free to customize and tailor these to your needs.

## Step 4: Instance Configuration

- Specify the instance configuration, including whether you want to install a default instance or a named instance. If choosing a named instance, provide a unique name.

### What’s an instance?

An instance is essentially a distinct installation of the SQL Server database engine on a server, with default instances being simpler and using the default port, while named instances allow for multiple independent installations with unique configurations. For the sake of simplicity and people new to SQL server, I would recommend you opt for a default instance.

## Step 5: Server Configuration

- Configure the server by establishing authentication modes, choosing between Windows Authentication or Mixed Mode. This step is for securing your database and preventing unauthorized access.
- If you are using a shared computer, opt for Mixed Mode to require both Windows Authentication and a password for the system administrator account.
- On a personal computer, you can use Windows Authentication for a simpler login process.

## Step 6: Database Engine Configuration

This step involves configuring server-wide settings, such as SQL Server administrators and data directories. Use default configurations if you're unsure or customize based on project requirements. Consider data directory locations and SQL Server administrators for optimal performance.

## Step 7: Installation

- Review the summary of your configurations and proceed with the installation. This process may take some time.

**Congratulations!** You've now successfully installed and configured Microsoft SQL Server. This powerful database management system opens up a world of possibilities for data storage and retrieval. Remember to stay informed about the latest updates and best practices in SQL Server administration. Happy coding with Microsoft SQL Server!

posts.title: The tech stack behind Bloggy
posts.author: Taylor
posts.description: An overview of what makes Bloggy tick.
posts.content:
To create bloggy we have used a variety of languages, frameworks, and libraries. In this post I will explain what each tool does, and why we have used it to create Bloggy!

## Frontend

### HTML

HTML or Hyper Text Markup Language makes up the skeleton of Bloggy. Most of the actual content that is displayed on Bloggy is not located within the HTML files directly however.

### CSS

CSS is what describes the way Bloggy should look. We are using vanilla CSS with no preprocessors or frameworks. To do this we are simply using one stylesheet that describes all of bloggy, and we make use of classes and id's where appropriate.

### JavaScript

JavaScript is where much of the on screen magic happens for Bloggy. We use four main JavaScript files. Each HTML page has it's own JS file that gives it special functionality.

For our home page in particular, we have implemented a technique called **Lazy Loading** that loads in new blog posts as the user scrolls down. This ensures that resources are saved, page load speeds are improved and it gives the impression of an infinite scroll!

### JSON

We use JSON as a flexible and easy way to organize and store our blogs on Bloggy. It enables us to quickly store and retrieve our blogs in an easy to read format.

## Backend

### Node.js

Node.js is a powerful runtime that expands JavaScript into a full stack language! Node enables us to write backend in JavaScript that can easily integrate with the frontend.

Node is fast, scalable and efficient which is perfect for Bloggy. It also gives us access to the huge ecosytem of **NPM** which allows us to quickly and easily modulate Bloggy with various free tools and libraries!

### Express.js

Express is a web framework for Node.js that greatly simplifies the server creation process. It can handle HTTP requests and responses across our application and can interact directly with a database (coming soon)!
This means that Bloggy is a server-side rendered application!

## Libraries

### Multer

Multer is a middleware tool that we use with Express and Node to allow users to upload images to Bloggy.

### EasyMDE

EasyMDE is an awesome all-in-one text editor that we use for Bloggy's New Post page. It allows users to quickly style and mark up their blogs, and preview how it will appear before submission!
It really makes it easy to write blog posts directly in MarkDown

### MD-Block

MD-Block is nice little library that we use to display formatted text as MarkDown. This allows us to save the blog posts as plain text files and convert them as needed to simplify the development process.

### Cropper.js

Cropper is a library that does what it suggests, crops images. We use Cropper to allow users to upload images of any size and cut them down if needed to display properly on Bloggy. This way users do not need to worry about what size their images are.

## Conclusion

This has been a quick overview of the tech stack that makes up Bloggy! As we continue to develop and grow Bloggy we will be sure to update this list.

posts.title: How to Reserve a Campus Study Space
posts.author: Nate
posts.description: Guide for Reserving and Cancelling Reservations.
posts.content:
How to Reserve a Campus Study Space at UW Tacoma

Hi y’all! This is Nate, a fellow UW Tacoma student teaching you how to reserve a study space for those times you need to find a quiet spot for studying or group projects.

Step 1: Establish account in 25Live

Firstly, you need to create a [25Live](https://tacoma.uw.edu/25live) account, which is the platform used to reserve study spaces at UW Tacoma. When you visit the site, you will be prompted to enter your standard UW credentials (username, password). After that, visit this [page](https://apps.tacoma.uw.edu/25live-training/group/2/module/3/answer/4) to confirm that you have logged into 25Live using your UW NetID.

Step 2: Review Space Use Guidelines

In the next page, you will be given terms in which you will need to abide by with every reservation you make with 25Live.

Step 3: Watch Online Tutorial Video

Next, you will be prompted to watch a [short tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SIukzM1kBA8) on how to create and cancel reservations in 25Live.

As a quick summary of the video, you will specifically be able to:

- Select a date/time for the reservation
- Select reservation duration (maximum is 2 hours)
- Choose reservation location (dropdown menu will show capacity of each available room)
- Name the reservation with a title
- See calendar of other reservations made at the same location
- Cancel reservation if needed

Final Thoughts

That’s it! All you need to know about using 25Live to reserve study spaces can be summarized in just 3 steps. Hope you enjoy following this quick guide.

Reference <https://www.tacoma.uw.edu/uuf/campus-study-spaces#permalink-29170>

posts.title: UW Tacoma TLC (Teaching & Learning Center) Guide
posts.author: Nate
posts.description: Details on How to Use the TLC to your Advantage.
posts.content:
Hello! It’s Nate again back at it with another guide. This time I’ll be explaining what the TLC is and how you can use it for your own benefit during your time here at UW Tacoma.

**What Exactly is the TLC?**

The TLC is a building at UW Tacoma that offers a wide range of academic support services designed to help students in their academic journey. Consultants work with students in writing, quantitative areas, and even broad academic strategies through Peer Mentors in order to help them gain the necessary skills and confidence needed for overall academic success.

*Before using the TLC, be sure to sign up for a TLC account online [here](https://uwttlc.mywconline.com/register.php) to set up an appointment beforehand*

**Writing**

We provide assistance through 30- or 60-minute appointments, be it in-person, via Zoom, or asynchronously. Our support encompasses all facets of the writing process, including:

- Clarification of assignments and adherence to disciplinary writing standards.
- Comprehensive feedback on drafts and various assignments.
- Guidance on essential writing strategies, such as:
- Brainstorming and idea development
- Crafting a coherent thesis and argument
- Understanding the intricacies of the revision process
- Enhancing proficiency in grammar, punctuation, and word choice
- Aid in adhering to citation styles such as MLA, APA, Chicago, IEEE, ASE, and AP

Rest assured, our commitment is to assist you at every stage of your writing journey.

**Quantitative Skills**

We've got your back when it comes to a range of quantitative subjects. We cover:

- Math
- Statistics
- Environmental Sciences
- Computer Science
- Economics
- Accounting
- Math review for new students

And that's not all! We're also here to help you navigate software and calculators for math and statistics. Plus, we can assist you in honing those study skills essential for tackling math, statistics, and other quantitative subjects.

**Academic Success Strategies**

Our Peer Success Mentors offer in-person or Zoom consultations to help with academic success strategies, such as:

- Time management
- Study strategies
- Organization
- Reading strategies
- Goal-setting
- Test-taking strategies

Final Thoughts

That’s how to use the TLC to your advantage. With this knowledge, you can be sure to get the support you need to eventually get that diploma you so rightfully earned.

posts.title: How to Activate GitHub Pro for Free (UW Students)
posts.author: Nick
posts.description: A guide on how to activate GitHub Pro for free as a UWT student.
posts.content:
Hey! Nick here, for this technical blog I’ll be guiding you through 6 steps to activate GitHub Pro for free (as a UW student).

As a University of Washington student, you have the unique opportunity to access GitHub Pro for free. This guide will walk you through the process, helping you unlock powerful collaboration, code review, and code management tools that can be essential for modern software development.


## Step 1: Check Your Eligibility

Before you begin, ensure that you meet the following criteria:



* You're currently enrolled at the University of Washington.
* You have a verifiable school-issued email address or can provide documents proving your current student status.
* You're at least 13 years old.


## Step 2: Create or Use an Existing GitHub Account

If you don't already have a GitHub account, create one using your personal email. This is recommended to maintain access post-graduation. For existing users, simply sign into your account.


## Step 3: Apply to ‘GitHub Global Campus’



1. Visit [GitHub Education](https://education.github.com/) and sign in with your GitHub account.
2. Navigate to "Benefits" and click on "Get student benefits".
3. Select "Student" as your academic status and use your school email.
4. Enter the University of Washington as your school and describe what you plan to use GitHub for.
5. Click ‘Continue’.
6. After that page, you'll need to upload proof of your academic status, like a school ID or enrollment document.


## Step 4: Wait for Verification

After submitting your application, GitHub will review it. This process may take a few days.

You will receive a confirmation email once your application is approved. Personally, it took about three days for them to verify my application.


## Step 6: Enjoy Your GitHub Pro Benefits

Once your GitHub Pro access is approved, as a University of Washington student, you'll unlock a powerful set of features and additional resources on GitHub:



* **GitHub Pro Enhancements:** Enjoy advanced support, increased action minutes, more storage, and sophisticated tools for private repositories.
* **Developer Tools:** Access 3,000 GitHub Actions minutes, 2 GB Packages storage, and 180 GitHub Codespaces core hours monthly.
* **Educational Resources: **Benefit from the GitHub Student Developer Pack, including $200 Digital Ocean credit, a free domain from Namecheap, and a renewable JetBrains IDE subscription.

These tools not only bolster your development skills but also provide a real-world software development experience, crucial for your academic and professional growth.


## Final Thoughts

Activating GitHub Pro as a University of Washington student opens a world of opportunities. It's more than just gaining access to professional tools; it's about joining a global community of developers and enhancing your learning experience.

Remember, the process may vary slightly over time, so always check for the latest updates. Happy coding!

posts.title: How to Plan for UW Registration (Using Degree Audit)
posts.author: Nick
posts.description: A guide for newer UWT students on how to use the Degree Audit Tool (DARS) to prepare to register for classes.
posts.content:
For new students at the University of Washington, planning your course registration effectively is crucial. The Degree Audit Reporting System (DARS) is an invaluable tool for this process. It helps you track your academic progress and identify the courses you need to complete your degree.


## What is DARS?

DARS provides a detailed report of your academic journey, showing how your courses - whether UW courses, in-progress, or transfer courses - apply towards your degree requirements. It's an essential tool for both undergraduate and graduate students.


## Accessing DARS



* **Requesting a Degree Audit:** Go to the [degree audit page in MyPlan](https://myplan.uw.edu/audit/#/degree), accessible via [myUW](https://my.uw.edu/). Here, you can request, view, and print degree audits for any available degree program offered at UWT.
* **Reading the Audit: **The audit breaks down requirements into university, college, and major sections, each with specific sub-requirements. Understanding these sections is key to interpreting how close you are to meeting your degree needs.


## Key Features of DARS



* **Requirements Overview:** Understand specific requirements for your major and general education.
* **Total University Credit:** Compare your total credits and GPA with what’s required.
* **Exceptions and In-Progress Courses:** See any waivers or substitutions and how current courses affect your progress.
* **Understanding Symbols: **Familiarize yourself with symbols shown on DARS reports like ‘OK’ (meaning requirement satisfied), ‘NO’ (requirement not satisfied), and ‘IP’ (in progress).


## Utilizing DARS for Registration



* **Identify Unfulfilled Requirements**: Use DARS to pinpoint courses you still need.
* **Plan Upcoming Semesters: **Based on your degree audit, strategize your course load for future semesters.
* **Consult with Advisers:** Your audit provides a starting point for discussions with academic advisers.


## Final Thoughts

I can tell you from experience that DARS greatly simplifies the course selection and academic planning process. By regularly reviewing your degree audit, you can make informed decisions about your courses and stay on track for graduation.

Remember, DARS is a guide to assist you and your adviser in planning your future coursework at University of Washington. It’s not just about meeting requirements; it’s about strategically planning your academic journey.
